website_summaries.verdict: A popular insole that’s great for any foot issues and versatile for any shoe type.
pros: Sturdy and semi-rigid without being uncomfortable
Instant pain relief for longtime sufferers of foot issues like plantar fasciitis – works even better than expensive custom orthotics for some
Works in athletic, casual, dress, and work boots
cons: Because this insole supports all arch types, not enough arch for some
There’s a breaking in period that requires patience

website_summaries.verdict: Though they have similar features to competitors, the fit has the tendency to be slightly "off" for some and the support is on the rigid side.
pros: A durable pair of inserts that stands out for their double-layered foam support
Doesn't take long for most wearers to break them in
cons: Several consumers reported that they didn't fit some shoes
The arch is somewhat firm, but those who require extra support may find this helpful

customer_reviews.title: Bad Quality, Read Recent Reviews First. Mine Lasted 16 days. NON-RETURNABLE
customer_reviews.text: Believe other reviews! Prior to these, I have worn Powerstep orthotics, as recommended by my podiatrist, no problem. These broke down in 16 days. cup for the heel is now protruding and making me sore. While other reviewers might not have needed/understood this device, this is NOT the 'year or so' I expect from Powerstep products.There is NO REASON the cushion material should have broken down in days.
customer_reviews.author: R. Richardson

customer_reviews.title: Quality has declined
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased several pairs of these over the years and loved them. My most recent pair wore out in 27 days, probably a defect. Note: I am a 60 year old walker. I contacted Powerstep and they did not really care... just deal with wherever you purchased them. Now I am dealing with a return (just made the 30 day window) and looking for a better product.. The pair on the left were 6 months old, on the right only 27 days. Being diabetic, there is no way I could have walked with a rock in my shoe.
customer_reviews.author: BJBB

customer_reviews.title: Don't last long at all.
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable to wear in any kind of shoes. My feet are never in pain any more. Reason for a bad review is after just a month and a half the plastic support under the padding is falling apart. It is too the point now where piece are actually breaking off and stabbing my foot randomly at work, so even during some of the busiest times I'll have to stop, take off my shoe, find and remove the broken piece, and get back to it. Working restaurant, this is very inconvenient.
customer_reviews.author: RedManE36

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: They worked great the first wear. By the second wear could feel the underside sliding up to the side of my ankle. Sure enough I got home an they look like this. This was the second time I bought these hoping that they’d be better because the other pair wasn’t an authorized seller. They are exactly the same and I think it’s ridiculous that I paid $35 for them to fall apart the second time I used them. I’m really disappointed because they relieved my plantar fasciitis pain but not once they fell apart.
customer_reviews.author: Mystique

customer_reviews.title: Superfeet versus pinnacle
customer_reviews.text: I tried out the Pinnacle the Superfeet between those two the Pinnacle is better. I couldn't believe the comfort of the Arches support. On the Superfeet it had good comfort but still a little hard on the forefoot I used them in basketball shoes and they seem to be holding up pretty well. They have good cushion I wouldn't say spectacular but they have just enough to where you don't mind wearing them while you play I have been looking for more of a cushiony setup but this Pinnacle really surprise me with how comfortable it was. It was definitely worth the try and out of the two I would pick the Pinnacle over the Superfeet athletic
customer_reviews.author: Andrew C.

customer_reviews.title: Great for flat footed pain
customer_reviews.text: My husband works for an apartment management company as a special projects maintenance professional. He is on his feet for many hours a day in steel toe work boots. He like many others has a flat foot issue that was not to the point of plantar fasciitis but still painful. The doctor recommended these to me for my plantar fasciitis and they helped me so much so we ordered some for him. He can wear them for up to a about 9 months before the wear it too much. The pictures show 1 year of wear.
customer_reviews.author: Jk

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last
customer_reviews.text: I liked the fit and feel but the toe wore out in just two months. I got a blister on my toe from this. See photo.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Leandro

customer_reviews.title: Love these insoles
customer_reviews.text: I love these insoles. I’ve worn these for a few years and typically replace them when I get new tennis shoes. The last time I bought new shoes, I went without the insole. I thought it was fine until my plantar fasciitis flared up and my feet felt more tired. When it was time for new shoes, I reordered the insoles. Now I’m not sure why I skipped them. My arch is better supported, less pain in my knee and my legs & feet feel better at the end of the day. I do think you have to try different insoles to find what works best for you, but I’d recommend giving them a try.
customer_reviews.author: Sage

customer_reviews.title: Great when they lasted.  Didn't last as long as expected.
customer_reviews.text: They were great while they lasted. A lot of the other insoles are jelly soft. These are nice and sturdy without being hard or uncomfortable. Its like an airbed versus a firm mattress. After about 6 months, though, small holes started forming in places where I applied the most pressure when I walk, which gradually got bigger, making them uncomfortable. Mind you, I don't wear those shoes every day either. I'd estimate that they'd last 2-3 months of daily use. I liked my time with them, but they didn't last nearly long enough for me to get a second pair.
customer_reviews.author: Elian

customer_reviews.title: HIGHEST ARCH
customer_reviews.text: Don't let my headline mislead. I'm trying several inserts to help relieve my plantar fasciitis pain. This one appears to have a slightly higher arch than the others, so I'm looking forward to breaking it in. The box at least says that. My podiatrist said that almost any good quality insert is as good as any custom-made orthotic, and this one appears to be very well made. I understand it will take several days or weeks to break it in, but after just a few days, I'm very satisfied with the quality and the comfort of this one. I'm using it in my day hiking boots, so they will be put to the test. So far, so good.
customer_reviews.author: Virginia Falcon

customer_reviews.title: I love these
customer_reviews.text: I work in a pharmacy and am on my feet all day. I have flat feet and have had problems with plantar fasciitis. These have great support and allows me to work all day without foot pain. For the price they are a good value. One pair of daily use lasts me about 6 months. I have been using this brand for years now and it is the only one I have tried that works so well. I highly recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: David N

customer_reviews.title: Ouch!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is the most painful orthotic I've ever had on my foot in my entire lifetime. The interesting thing is a lot of podiatrist recommended it. Of course the podiatrist that recommended it can keep selling other products so there must be a high and markup on the product. Talking to her real people in the field of fashion and sports they had the same painful experience and never got to wear them more than a few days best to avoid this one.
customer_reviews.author: RS

customer_reviews.title: I tried the Cheaper Imitations but the Original is the Best
customer_reviews.text: These insoles make a world of difference in the comfort and support of your shoes. Sadly, I tried another brand that looked like Powerstep but weren't and they were not worth it. Once these new Powerstep's went back in, my feet felt like they were wrapped in pillows. I have peripheral neuropathy and my feet are in pain all the time but with these Powerstep's I can be up and around for hours. I'll only be ordering these Powerstep insoles from here on out.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Gerber

customer_reviews.title: If you get plantar fasciitis, you need a good orthotic - this is a good choice
customer_reviews.text: Then, find a great tennis shoe and do your stretches - go online and find those that offer help you can do and be patient...it takes a while - a long while to recover. These are a great start to that long road of recovery. Your arches aren't what they used to be when you were young. They mess up your calf muscles, your knees, on up to your hips and back. Everything is connected and good arch support like these are a must. These are nicely priced as well. All the best to you. Oh, and they'll last you about two years treating them nicely ;-)
customer_reviews.author: 333Jim

customer_reviews.title: Alleviated pain in my knees!
customer_reviews.text: Living with knee pain for about 5 years, I'm always searching for ways to alleviate pain and prevent further injury. Though I engage in therapy and weightlifting to maintain and improve my joint health, these inserts have done a fantastic job of immediately reducing pain in my knees from altering my foot arch, alignment, and stability when walking/standing. I definitely recommend these for anyone with knee pain or various foot conditions.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas

customer_reviews.title: For me a painful experience
customer_reviews.text: I used to buy inserts from a shoe store, store discontinued the ones that worked for me. At the new shoe store they recommended these for my new shoes. Left fit the right hurt my feet. I figured one worked so I ordered another thinking okay maybe the one had the right foot off. Nope still painful. Switched it to another shoe, same issue. Moralof the story, well rated really doesn't mean anything when it comes to insoles. Many brands left to try.
customer_reviews.author: RGD WA

customer_reviews.title: Makes my life so much better.
customer_reviews.text: I have been using these for years. Every pair of new Brooks running shoe I get, I get a new set of these (~once a year). Couldn't be happier with them. They do make your feet a bit toasty, but it's worth the pain relief for me. There was also prompt delivery through amazon, versus having to a wait a little longer if you order through PowerStep's website.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: might work but not for someone that's heavy, 300lbs +
customer_reviews.text: looked nice.... seems ok in general, but provided no support as hoped. does not help with walk, heel or arch pain, or relief for feet in general. Might work better for someone not as heavy as I am. will not buy again.... I would return them but item is not returnable for whatever reason...... so really not happy about that. ends up a waste of money... I expected more from them for their cost. And would expect a return to be offered if not satisfied with item. Would rate a zero for that reason alone if i could....
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Smith

customer_reviews.title: 13yo daughter found complete relief
customer_reviews.text: My daughter has increased pronation and has had foot pain for quite awhile. Our chiropractor recommended these, and it fixed the problem literally overnight. After the quarantine started in March, her feet started hurting again. We finally put it together that since she was home all day and not wearing shoes, she didn't have her typical support! We bought house-shoes and put these in them, and again the pain went away immediately. I am so thankful for these wonderful supports! She just pops them out and moves them to her other shoes when we go somewhere...
customer_reviews.author: Sincerity

customer_reviews.title: Haven't had them last more than a few months.
customer_reviews.text: The product had a great start. I've bought three pairs hoping for better results each time. Other than the pair that was eaten by a dog, I've found the following issue with the other two pairs: - The blue fabric rubs off and comes lose after a few months. I've used glue and had to repair it a few times. - once that blue fabric layer comes off, the hard insert comes lose and it really gets tough to keep repairing - the fabric holds odors really well, so they stunk and required regular washing. I wasn't expecting them to eat odors, but it was worse than anything else I've had in my shoes.
customer_reviews.author: kyler

customer_reviews.title: Don't leave home without them!
customer_reviews.text: I'm retired, so I basically live in t-shirts, jeans and Merrell hiking shoes. I have a low pair for the summer and a high top pair for the winter, so I buy a new pair of inserts for each seasonal transition (the inserts would probably last longer, but not worth finding out). I have bunions and if I go a day in bare feet, they hurt. But put my feet back in the shoes with inserts and I am comfortable and pain free. These things are worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: PSebelist

customer_reviews.title: Same orthotics sold by medical professionals for much less money. Great product.
customer_reviews.text: I have used these for at least twenty years. Every time I purchase shoes, I purchase new Powerstep Pinnacle orthotics. I had lumbar back surgery in 1982 and worked on my feet on concrete for 32 years after the surgery. I suffered arch and heel pain for 12 years before I got my first pair from a physical therapist. These are the same exact product for much less money and are very durable. I put them under the shoe cushion in New Balance shoes and they work great.
customer_reviews.author: Paul W.

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable and fit well
customer_reviews.text: Bought 1 pair of these to see if they helped my severe plantar fasciitis. Did reduce pain while wearing so have bought 2 more pairs. Fit my feet and my footwear much better than my higher priced New Balance inserts which also squeaked while walking. Although the arch is high the padding is much more effective than the NBs. It’s only been a couple of weeks so I can’t address durability. Wearing them in my running shoes (jogging and speed walking) and cowboy boots Fit very well in both.
customer_reviews.author: Texas 777

customer_reviews.title: Great insert, great shape.
customer_reviews.text: I've tried a lot of inserts. Too many have completely unnatural shaps that won't fit anyone's foot. These are among a small set of inserts with a well chosen shape. For my foot, this one fits my arch and heel better than any I've tried. Your foot shape might make you a better match for a different insert, but this one can not be faulted for being well made. There are several excellent inserts on the market. I love these. Rigid bottom with modest cushion fabric layers on top. The shape of these is superb. I've tried several good inserts, and several inserts . These fit my foot best.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Mansfield

customer_reviews.title: Powerstep inserts are GREAT
customer_reviews.text: I have had some pain issues twice over the last year after going on vacation that included lots of walking. And both times my ankle/foot was painful for several weeks afterwards with swelling. And then my knees would hurt also. These with the support throughout my foot and especially with my high arch are helping my foot heal. I hope it continues as I have had them just a little over a week now. These Powerstep inserts come with different levels of arch support. Try them out!
customer_reviews.author: Marg Mc

customer_reviews.title: Following my foot Drs advice!
customer_reviews.text: I was really hesitant in ordering this shoe insert off Amazon but my foot doctor highly recommened it to me. I put the insert into my shoes and began walking. It was quite uncomfortable but i do remember hearing that it will take some breaking in time to get used to them. My feet feel better than they have in a long time. I highly do recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: Bunny56

customer_reviews.title: Solved my arch support problems!!
customer_reviews.text: These are really great replacement footbeds for shoes with removal footbeds. So much better than the original inserts! I use these interchangably in several pairs of shoes, including my hiking boots, my walking shoes, and some casual shoes. Just be aware that these are to replace the inserts in shoes with removable insoles, not to go "on top" of non-removable insoles. The arch support is really great, and I can really feel them keeping me from pronation. They get even more comfortable after the foam cushioning molds in a bit. Really great.
customer_reviews.author: Isaac

customer_reviews.title: They are comfortable, were correct size and worked great except I ...
customer_reviews.text: They are comfortable, were correct size and worked great except I have had for a little over a month and they are falling apart. The blue top is coming off the foam and hard plastic part. I am trying another brand now. For the price they should last longer than a month. Update - It is like they do not glue the edges enough. The new pair I bought a month after these look brand new still. Wear same amount of time. I purchased the Spenco Total Support. So far those have worked great. Tried to contact Powerstep and never heard back from them.
customer_reviews.author: Steven S.

customer_reviews.title: The Glass Slipper for Sore Feet
customer_reviews.text: These FINALLY have relieved my plantar fasciitis and heel pain better than anything else - other orthotics, doctor visits, injections, taping, boots, etc. It says they're for "mild pronation" - I have a fairly high arch and normally wear neutral running shoes, but I found even with liners out most "neutral" orthotics were pushing my foot too far to the outside. These are working well for me. Padding is excellent, arch support is adequate, and the heel cup keeps the heel from getting further irritated by moving around..
customer_reviews.author: M.G.

customer_reviews.title: Arches a little forward
customer_reviews.text: These have a high, ball shaped part, for arch support; this is a fraction of an inch too close to the toes. I would prefer it sat down closer to the heal. This is probably because my arches are far back. Other than that (which doesn’t really cause problems unless I try to put them in shoes that were already thigh in the toes), they are great and make all my boots so much easier to stand in all day.
customer_reviews.author: James LampPost

customer_reviews.title: Not as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I bought this new pair because it states they CAN be used with dress shoes. This is NOT the case. I previously purchased the Powerstep Pinnacle Maxx Full Length Orthotic Shoe Insoles which are great, however due to the raised hill of the insoles they cannot be worn with dressy shoes. Both style insoles are identical ! So, I paid more money for something I already had. Now, the unused pair stays in the box and I still have nothing for the dressy shoes. Unfortunately, I did not notice that you only have a month to return them. I am disappointed in the wrong advertising only, the quality however is great.
customer_reviews.author: R. N.

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware - no returns for any reason!
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed with quality of product for the price paid (very cheap feeling and quality compared to similar products). Decided to return them without ever wearing them but didn't realize Amazon sold material goods that couldn't be returned. Guess it's my fault for assuming you could return non perishable goods on Amazon, didn't realize I had to research the return policy for every item I buy on Amazon. Cheap product and complete waste of money!
customer_reviews.author: Arnie422

customer_reviews.title: No good!
customer_reviews.text: I didn't find these inserts helpful. Which was disappointing since I bought them based on the overall good reviews. They didn't help my plantar fasciitis at all, in fact, I noticed I was in a bit more pain after using them, specifically after a workout. They also ran a bit big. I wear a size 10 in woman's shoes, and these were too big. They fit into my gym shoes, but it was a tight squeeze to put the inserts in (yes, after removing the inserts the shoes come with). The inserts didn't fit into any of my day-to-day shoes either - my flats, heels, casual shoes - nope. Disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Naz

customer_reviews.title: Podiatrist recommended
customer_reviews.text: These were recommended to me by a podiatrist. Great for over pronaters. Very affordable and well made. I now have 2 pairs.
customer_reviews.author: R.

customer_reviews.title: Works as well as very expensive orthotics
customer_reviews.text: I have plantar fasciitis and if i don't wear an orthotic that supports my arch (I have flat arches) as well as cushions my heel, it flares up. I'm a nurse. I've gotten 3 steroid shots in my sole, purchased $500 custom orthotics from my podiatrist and this works better and is more comfortable. It did take some time for my feet to adjust to them. By the 2nd week of working in them, I only feel comfort when I put them in my running shoes. I've tried them in my $150 pair of Brooks and $60 pair of Adidas and I feel the same comfort.
customer_reviews.author: JMadison

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: I have a foot problem similar to norton's neuroma, swelling and pain in the metatarsal pad and joints of the 2nd & 3rd toes. This was probably caused by taking dance classes on shoes with inadequate arch support and padding of the metatarsal pad. So, these provide great arch support and took pressure off the painful area. I only wish the metatarsal pd of this orthotic was a little thicker or had a little bit of padding to it as it is the thinnest part of the orthotic, and flat. Most casual shoe soles have a little squishiness to it. I put a metatarsal pad on it but it made it a little too thick to be comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: T2schiller

customer_reviews.title: Helped my husband's knee pain
customer_reviews.text: We bought these on recommendation from a doctor for my husband's knee pain. We had ruled out any treatable conditions first, so this isn't to be a substitute for medical advice. My husband works on a concrete floor all day, and he had a lot of knee pain from an old injury. These insoles have made a world of difference for him, and he wears them everywhere now and is pain-free. He has to buy 2 to 3 pairs per year though because he uses them so much and works in his feet all day.
customer_reviews.author: Jade Lazlow

customer_reviews.title: Great insoles for plantar fasciitis
customer_reviews.text: I have terrible plantar fasciitis in my left foot and this brand of insoles was recommended in a PF FB group. I decided to give them a try and glad I did! They have reduced my pain level immensely. I purchased a second pair to put in another of pair of shoes, but sometimes just switch them out when I rotate shoes. The only bad part is that because they are a little thicker, they do not fit into all of my shoes. Going forward I will be buying shoes that will accommodate these inserts.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Mendez

customer_reviews.title: Pain in my heel is gone
customer_reviews.text: I was having some pain in my heel and after talking to my doctor he recommended I try some inserts. I tried these in a few pairs of my shoes and after walking in them for about a month now, I can say they made a significant improvement for me. I put them in some minimal Merrel's, a pair of red wing work boots, and my gym shoes and they made a difference in all. I do have a high arch and neutral pronation if that helps you. I'd recommend getting a pair and trying them. Oh, and they fit without having to cut them.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas McCartney

customer_reviews.title: Great support for plantar fasciatis
customer_reviews.text: Great support for plantar fasciatis. Helps a lot with walking (for exercise) with these insoles in. I think the Powerstep insoles may be helping my knees too. I highly recommend them. The Powerstep Pinnacle gives a lot of arch support. It raises your foot in the shoe. I just loosened my laces when I inserted them in my shoes and it felt fine. I suggest buying the powerstep insoles first and then taking them to the store to buy your athletic shoes. By trying the athletic shoes on with the powerstep insoles you will get the best athletic shoe with the great support of the Powerstep insoles.
customer_reviews.author: JDoc

customer_reviews.title: Pinnacles are tops
customer_reviews.text: These insoles are the best on the market for plantar fasciitis. I have tried 2 others.
customer_reviews.author: ABBA

customer_reviews.title: Want to walk as far and as often as you want to?  Get these!
customer_reviews.text: I buy my shoes a half size larger so the insoles fit in the shoe with my foot comfortably. These not a cure for plantar fasciitis but they really do help. Alot. I put a pair in my work boots, running shoes and hiking shoes and WOW what a difference! If you're considering these to ease the pain of plantar fasciitis, go for it. Stretch the calves often and thoroughly, keep a frozen water bottle in the freezer to roll your feet on after exercising and GET THESE INSERTS! You won't regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tried a lot of inserts these are the best. I had really bad foot and heel pain ...
customer_reviews.text: Tried a lot of inserts these are the best. I had really bad foot and heel pain from working on a ladder for months doing house renivations and not wear good support in my shoes. No ladders for awhile.My Dr told me these are what you need to wear to get rid of planters fasciitis and heel pain. The Dr stated only firm supports help. Semi soft inserts that give too much allow your arch to move and cause more pain; powersteps don't give and are great. Recommend to alleviate heel and planters fasciitis pain. They may seems too firm at first but your foot will adjust if you do you foot and arch stretches.
customer_reviews.author: thomas pate

customer_reviews.title: Not so much
customer_reviews.text: I hate giving a bad review but there it is. My podiatrist told me to order these and we did, a couple of times, and I put them in all my shoes. Memory foam in shoes is a joke, it squished down and stayed there providing no cushion at all. They get two stars because the hard part did provide support. Now I have found a local supplier of inserts with support and gel for the cushion, now that’s a great idea. I decided the podiatrist could be replaced with a better one too.
customer_reviews.author: meandmytreasures

customer_reviews.title: These work! I have flat feet!
customer_reviews.text: I carefully read the review before I bought these. I have flat feet and my left foot has become increasingly painful with any shoe I wore. When these insoles arrived, I immediately put them to the test and placed them into the sneakers I wear for Zumba class. During class, my feet did not hurt (like they usually would without these insoles) and they really offer support for my bad left arch. Now, I wear them all the time for my class. If you have flat feet, try these out. They really helped me.
customer_reviews.author: Charlene

customer_reviews.title: Overall decent support with some major flaws!
customer_reviews.text: I liked that it has great and really sturdy arch support and heel support on sides. I absolutely hate that there isn’t enough heal cushion to absorb shock!! Otherwise I would have given it 5 stars
customer_reviews.author: Kristopher Jones

customer_reviews.title: I love these. As a mail carrier
customer_reviews.text: I love these. As a mail carrier, I'm on my feet up to 14 hours a day, and these provide arch support that other insoles and pretty much all shoes do not. Before buying these, I needed to soak my feet every day after work because they hurt so much. After using these, my feet feel fine. The blue part rubs off after a while, exposing the sticky yellow cushion underneath, which comes apart with friction. Best to use a cheap squishy insole on top for added cushion and to protect this one from falling apart.
customer_reviews.author: John W.

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.text: Amazing! Instant relief. After two days of using these, I had no pain. They did take a little getting used to, but so glad I stuck with them. Ordering more. My heel pain is pretty intense and constant, especially when on my feet. These support my feet and it feels like they stretch my arch and take pressure off my heels. I got heel pads that insert in shoes and they made it worse. These are perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: powerstep too large
customer_reviews.text: This is the item I ordered; however it does not fit into my size 10 show. I have tried to return it for a smaller size but was told not eligible for refund or return.. I sought help via the options available; however none led to a logical conclusion.
customer_reviews.author: 757 Pilot

customer_reviews.title: Better than any other insole I've bought, even those at higher prices.
customer_reviews.text: This pair of insoles fit my size 14 wide hiking boots perfectly. They are a vast improvement over the insoles provided by Merrell. One thing I really appreciated is, no trimming was required. It's a nice feature, that they're actually sized for my boots. And not a one size fits many, but trimming required, insoles. Plus, the support provided is far superior to any of the insoles, I've previously purchased at an equal or greater cost. I will be purchasing additional pairs for my other shoes and boots. I consider these to be well worth the money spent.
customer_reviews.author: T in Texas

customer_reviews.title: Too wide in the heal and arch area
customer_reviews.text: The quality of this item appears very good. However, the Powerstep Pinnacle Full Length Orthopedic Foot Insoles Support, 12 - 13.5 Men/ 14-15.5 Women has sizing issues. It is a good to slightly too long fit in length for a size 12 man like me and the extra length could be trimmed. But the width of the insole between the heel and arch area is too wide and not possible to trim. It is stiff enough to be seen as pushing against the sides of my shoes from the mid-section of the foot back to the heel. It would eventually damage the shoe. SSI Supply did not allow returns but thankfully Amazon stepped in to make things right. Thanks, Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: NO RETURNS!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Hated it. Hurts my feet and too large to fit in shoe. Too hard, not enough give. No returns which was not stated as far as I can see. Won’t buy this brand again. Would give it zero stars but that’s not an option.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Eh... I don't know just yet about these
customer_reviews.text: My doc recommended these for plantar fascitis. I've been wearing them for about 3 days and they're a whole lot of support that I'm not used to. I'll know more in a week of wearing them if I last that long with 'em.
customer_reviews.author: S. Weber

customer_reviews.title: Give them a try.  You'll be glad you did!
customer_reviews.text: I have recommended these to multiple plantar fasciitis/heel spur sufferers since I discovered these. After countless visits to doctors, therapists and way too much pain from plantar fasciitis and a large heel spur I did my own research and found these gems. I wear them in slippers as well as shoes for consistent support. They changed my world 5 years ago when I discovered them. I went so far as to discuss them with staff at a local running shop before my first purchase. They are top rate. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Bren

customer_reviews.title: If anything, my feet hurt more after using them
customer_reviews.text: I tried them for a week as recommended, never helped - in fact, hurt more. I have the high priced insoles from the podiatrist - those work.
customer_reviews.author: John C. Awald

customer_reviews.title: Not cheap, but effective
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these orthotics at the recommendation of my podiatrist, who is treating me for plantar fasciitis. These inserts work surprisingly well once you've gotten accustomed to having the extra support they provide. The package directions recommend using the inserts for a few hours to start, gradually progressing to all day wear. This is good advice. It's also advisable to remove any insoles in your shoes before putting in the orthotics. Otherwise, the shoes are likely to be too tight in the instep. I'm very pleased with the fact that my condition appears to be healing (pun intended) as a result of using the inserts in combination with shoes that don't flex excessively.
customer_reviews.author: Susan in Austin TX

customer_reviews.title: Like walking with a large stone under your foot’s bridge
customer_reviews.text: Like walking with a large stone under your foot’s bridge, makes your sneakers look like a big, fat, overstuffed burrito when donning shoe. I would buy again as a torturing device.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Antoun

customer_reviews.title: MUCH better!
customer_reviews.text: Fit was great right out of the box; no trimming. I typically wait too long before replacing insoles, and these got rid of a lot of foot/leg pain I was experiencing.
customer_reviews.author: Rich Morrison

customer_reviews.title: Felt comfortable at first but after a day the arch supports ...
customer_reviews.text: I don't understand numerous 5 star reviews. Experiences must vary. Mine was negative. Felt comfortable at first but after a day the arch supports caused aches in the middle of my feet. pain. Tried again the next day and same result. Just didn't fit my foot. I have flat feet and a low arch so maybe that is the reason. Wished they had worked better. Also too expensive in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: W. H.

customer_reviews.title: Needed support + comfort.
customer_reviews.text: My wife now insists she get a new pair of these along with any new shoes she receives. She is a nurse and attributes these inserts with minimizing her pain and discomfort during her 12-13hr shifts (on her feet the entire time). These are in high demand. Our local custom shoe stores stock these, fortunately. Unfortunately they're over-priced. Best place/price is Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Clifton Mulanax

customer_reviews.title: Not what I had in mind
customer_reviews.text: I have used Super feet insoles in the past for several years . They cost more than I wanted to spend this time around so I decided to try these insoles . I was very disappointed . The arch of these is much higher than the Super feet and much stiffer . In the interim I have also decided to try minimalist running shoes and so won’t be using any insoles for now
customer_reviews.author: sassafrass66

customer_reviews.title: An actual orthotic
customer_reviews.text: I've paid well over $300 for custom orthotics in the past and thought I'd take chance with an amazon pair. Well these are the real deal. These are rigid in the arch and provided instant relief to a bone spur on my heel. I ordered a different pair at the same time as these and the difference is obvious. You won't go wrong with these.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Derderian

customer_reviews.title: Cost effective for foot pain
customer_reviews.text: I am size 10 and all my shoes (dress shoes, sneakers etc) are size 10. I bought size 10 insole. I had to trim the front a little bit with a pair of scissors. The sides are too wide near the middle, but there is no good way to trim it. It does make my sneakers look bigger. I bought this to relieve my foot pain near the big toe. I think the arch support from this insole helps a lot. It did not completely cure my problem, but i will say it is a cheap and effective solution to help with my foot pain.
customer_reviews.author: Opinion

customer_reviews.title: Lots of arch support
customer_reviews.text: Nice arch supports. My physical therapist recommended these arch supporting insoles to help heal up my injured ankle faster. Slipped the old flat insoles out of my shoes and slipped these in. These have a lot of arch support, which my feet aren't used to. I may end up ordering the Powerstep "Originals", which have less arch on them. (The Powerstep website lists all sorts of their orthotic insoles. Some with more arch, more cushion, for ball of foot pain, memory foam 3/4 length, wide feet, slender fit, and more.)
customer_reviews.author: Magical Dragon

customer_reviews.title: MUST BUY IF YOU HAVE PLANTAR FASCIITIS
customer_reviews.text: I have plantar fasciitis. My pediatrist told me I needed to get these. I put these in my shoes and walked about ten steps before I felt, the best way I can put into words, a "euphoric high." I had been in pain for months on end without knowing what the problem was. My feet and legs were instantly relieved in the short term and these helped with my pain in the long term as well. MUST BUY FOR THOSE WITH PLANTAR FASCIITIS!
customer_reviews.author: KyBret

customer_reviews.title: Really comfortable, but loud when you walk.
customer_reviews.text: The Pinnacle version of Powerstep is really comfortable. I also have the Powerstep Journey and while the Pinnacle doesn't have as much arch support, the do feel more comfortable when wearing them all day. The one flaw with these insoles is the have a horrible squeak when I walk. It's really noticeable when its quite or I'm in my house. When your out and about it's less noticeable because of background noise, but it's still there. The other versions of Powerstep do not squeak, so I think it's just the material of the Pinnacle version.
customer_reviews.author: The Barth's

customer_reviews.title: Good fit in shoes
customer_reviews.text: I have steel toe shoes that I am using these inserts in. I had to remove the sole insert and these slid right in place. A little stiff at first. I was having some instep discomfort with my left foot and probably should have followed another users recommendation and for the first couple of days only worn them part time to get them worked in. I've had no issue with my Plantar Fasciitis flaring up which is great. When these wear out I will buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: Richard J Keppner

customer_reviews.title: Poor heel support
customer_reviews.text: I accidentally ordered the neutral arch support and immediately tried to return them. I didn’t read the fine print that they were not refundable. My bad. So am trying to use them. Arch support is good enough but that heel support? It’s poor. Surprised as the advertising brags about the great heel support.
customer_reviews.author: Jakob Breunig

customer_reviews.title: great value and a must have for any shoe or boot
customer_reviews.text: i like these insoles so far. ii use them everyday in my work boots that i typically walk on average of 7500 + steps a day and make my boots a heck of a lot more comfortable then they are from the factory. We went from being able to wear any shoes to work boots even though i dont need boots for my job like the men/women that work for me but ive went from wearing walking/running shoes to my boots with these insoles and i have to say i will take my heavy boots with these in them over all the top running shoes i have.
customer_reviews.author: R.Rack

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: I had my first pair of these insoles for 3 years before they came apart - that's three years of regular wear and quite a few trips through the washer and dryer. Great for shoes like Keds and Converse where there's no arch support. I wear an 8 and bought the 8-9, and it fits my shoes perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: carb101

customer_reviews.title: Good arch support
customer_reviews.text: ** Good arch support ** I bought these to support the arches in my foot after being diagnosed with a slightly collapsed arch. They provide nice firm support. The soles take a little while to get used to (and comfortable), but provide excellent support. The arch support is quite rigid. ** FSA account eligible ** These are also claimable with just a receipt and no prescription under an FSA account.
customer_reviews.author: CJBS

customer_reviews.title: Probably saved my back and way of life
customer_reviews.text: I went to several doctors and had test after test trying to solve my back problems. I am 40 years old and looked and felt like I was 80....I had a friend recommend these and it has changed my life. I've tried everything...and I mean everything. I haven't had back pain in almost 6 months and am going to start to workout again for the first time in a few years.
customer_reviews.author: George T.

customer_reviews.title: Provides good support and comfort
customer_reviews.text: I originally received a pair of these from my physical therapist. Combined with running shoes that already provide some arch support, they really do help with my tendency to over-pronate when I walk. If I put them in my flat walking shoes, they're not quite as effective for me because of how high my arches are, but it's still better than no support at all. I found that the Women's 9-9.5 size fit in my size 9 sneakers just fine without me needing to trim it at all.
customer_reviews.author: Vy Tran

customer_reviews.title: Great inserts, both these and the Original insoles are ...
customer_reviews.text: Great inserts, both these and the Original insoles are great if you need arch support. I am also a plus size woman so I need something that can handle all the impact my feet can have while walking. These work really well and are very easy to transfer from shoe to shoe (provided you take out the shoe's insole so your feet aren't too snug). I typically buy new inserts every 6 months due to wearing these every day but they last well if you don't do too much walking in your daily life (when I use to be more active I bought Powerstep inserts every 4 months) these are a great price for relief in feet problems.
customer_reviews.author: Elise Hebert

customer_reviews.title: good fit and feel
customer_reviews.text: This insert has a hard sole but cushy top that feels good to wear while giving arch support. My 12 year old son with flat feet likes the feel inside his sneakers, which we buy the sneakers a half size up to accommodate the insert. I have bought these for my snow boots which lack any arch support. Nice and comfortable. They lasted my son a whole year before we had to buy new ones for his growing feet.
customer_reviews.author: Rocky Dodge

customer_reviews.title: EXTREMELY HELPFUL WITH BALANCE
customer_reviews.text: I have always had long (11-12),narrow (AA, N, or S) feet. As I have gotten older, my arch has disintegrated causing me to lose my balance, and I have had 3 significant falls. Both my podiatrist and the salesman at SAS shoes recommended this product. I am SO GLAD I FOUND THESE ON AMAZON and purchased them. What an improvement! Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Cuddler

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted - Dr. Recommended.
customer_reviews.text: These were recommended to me by my orthopedist. Each color does something a bit different so just be aware of that. The ones I bough a few years back I had to trim down to fit inside my size 13, wide toe box hiking boot. But the most recent one I purchased fit just right (same shoe brand and make). They give my arches just enough support that I was able to wean off my much bulkier custom orthotic. They're a wide, though - but to me, it's worth it. Love them.
customer_reviews.author: Larkus

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable support for long, flat feet!
customer_reviews.text: I have long, narrow, flat, sized 8.5 feet. I bought these because I am standing and walking for my job 8+ hours every day. I was worried that these inserts would make my feet sore and require more break in, but they didn’t. Within a couple of days, I felt like I couldn’t live without them! I generally purchase the most supportive super feet inserts, but I find these to be as supportive, and far more comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah

customer_reviews.title: Game changer for me!
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had a pair for every pair of shoes I own. My feet have been bothering me, and a friend shared with me her secret of using Powersteps Insoles in her shoes to stop her hip and foot pain. For about $20, I thought it was worth a try. It really has been a game changer for me. They fit into my tennis shoes as expected. After slipping out the other insole, the Powerstep Insoles fit perfectly into my shoe (tennis shoe/sneaker). They fit as expected, not too small or too large.
customer_reviews.author: Smart Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable supportive insole
customer_reviews.text: I have problems with plantar fascitis. I get bad pains under my arch and occasionally heal pain too. The Power Step were recommended to me by my podiatrist. I always used the Power Step originals and decided to try Pinnacle. They are cushioned but still provide good arch support. The original Power Steps have no cushioning at all, so this was a good change for me. I like them a lot.
customer_reviews.author: VCA

customer_reviews.title: So far, so great
customer_reviews.text: Just ordered this in hopes that this would help my better half's plantar fasciitis & then I decided I had to try something so I ordered these. Albeit, they were recently purchased, they've helped dramatically. Another great help was the really nice fit which was perfect. No cutting, sizing, just insert & go. I'll update this review if in the next few weeks our opinion of these insoles changes but honestly, I don't see that happening Btw, I bought these for a size 10 shoe & as I said prior, they fit exactly as they should. So happy...
customer_reviews.author: Deborah A.Top Contributor: Makeup

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful pain reliever
customer_reviews.text: These are absolutely wonderful for relieving pain in my feet from plantars fasciitis! I’m able to get my 10,000 steps in daily without so much pain by using these in my walking shoes. I just remove them after exercising and put them in some other shoes for the rest of the day. Wish they made a neutral color that could be slipped into sandals and other open toed shoes!
customer_reviews.author: Teacher mom

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable and excellent arch support.
customer_reviews.text: I got this after developing an episode of plantar fasciitis that make every step painful. There was almost immediate relief when these were inserted into my Fila shoes that cost only 1/2 of what these inserts did. They did not make the shoe fit too small at all, but instead gave a reasurring sensation of firm yet comfortable support. My fasciitis has long gone, but these still remain in place.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Toolsie

customer_reviews.title: Don’t bother
customer_reviews.text: They lasted for barely a month then they broke down. I started having horrible knee and foot pain. Bought another brand and all went away. Not worth the money!!!
customer_reviews.author: Meghan Brennan

customer_reviews.title: Try these first before wasting your money at a doctors office.
customer_reviews.text: These arch supports have worked for me as well as a pair of supports I previously had which required 3 doctor appointments, and an arch support prescription. The new supports were a bargain compared to the time I invested in doctor visits and the out of pocket 7-800 dollars I spent in fees that were not covered by insurance.
customer_reviews.author: PeterB

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and supportive
customer_reviews.text: Great arch support. Was recommended by physical therapy for foot/knee issues
customer_reviews.author: L. Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Ive tried the copper super feet which is probably the best so far
customer_reviews.text: So i work on steel decks and my feet hurt from long days of work. Ive tried the copper super feet which is probably the best so far. Also I've used the abeo from the walking store which is also very very good. At the price point i think these are the best. I also used the other green super feet and i hated those, they were a bit to hard. Also all the other cheap ones that you can buy in walgreens, i seriously wouldn't bother. Abeo's are better, super feet copper are my second fav. This one is my third but for the price this one is probably the one to buy.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Nakayama

customer_reviews.title: Great for walking
customer_reviews.text: I heard about these inserts from an employee at a running shoes company who told me they are the closest thing to a custom orthotic insert. He wasn’t wrong. I’ve bought a pair of these inserts for every pair of shoes I own. My job requires lots of walking and I could not last a day without my inserts.
customer_reviews.author: Jose Ortiz

customer_reviews.title: very good foot support at a great price
customer_reviews.text: Very good foot support at a great price. I have worn Dr. Scholl's custom orthotics($50) as well as prescription orthotics($200-$500). I experience foot pain often especially if I am standing on concrete for any length of time. Good orthotics in sturdy footwear helps a lot. I could not wear athletic shoes for more than about 30 minutes without my feet aching until I put a pair of these orthotics in my New Balance shoes. I will buy more.
customer_reviews.author: Doug B.

customer_reviews.title: The Powerstep Pinnacle Orthotics are fantastic!!
customer_reviews.text: The Powerstep Pinnacle Orthotics are fantastic!!! I inserted them in my badly worn Asics walking shoes and now they feel even more comfortable than when they were new. I didn't remove the original soles, but the shoes don't feel too tight and the cushioning is excellent. I often experience severe pain in my feet after walking for several hours, but there's been no pain recently. Am anxious to wear them when we travel next time. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Kat59

customer_reviews.title: insole
customer_reviews.text: I have planter fasciitis. I tried the shots 1 time. It gave some relief but still had pain. Then my appointment came for insoles and these are the best. Love these so much ❤
customer_reviews.author: Katherine

customer_reviews.title: The inserts work great for either level of activity
customer_reviews.text: My go-to inserts. Many pairs later I'm still a consumer. I've seen others and been suggested others but once you've found something that works it's hard to go with something else. I work as a retail meat cutter for 8-12 hours at a time. Periods of standing in place interspersed with lots of walking. The inserts work great for either level of activity. I have these in all of my shoes and boots.
customer_reviews.author: Sumo Ninja

customer_reviews.title: Happy Feet
customer_reviews.text: Like many reviewers, I have tried many shoe insoles over the years, and my 62 year old flat feet give a two thumbs up for Powerstep. Last year I purchased the Powerstep Original insoles and they worked well, not quite as stiff as my Soft Soles, but provided good support. ESPECIALLY FOR FLAT FEET, ENOUGH BUT NOT TOO MUCH ARCH. They seem to have survived moderate use, seem to be constructed with quality materials. I definitely upped my game with the Pinnacle model. Supportive, stiff yet soft, I now have 3 pairs for different shoes.
customer_reviews.author: silvertone

customer_reviews.title: Extremely comfortable. Perfect fit to size. Don't slide/move around at all which is a must for me.
customer_reviews.text: Great product. What I like best about these insoles vs the competitors is that it slightly stiff in a good way. When I say slightly stiff, that is because some of those Dr. Sholls are too "flimsy" and they will move around a lot inside of your shoes. Like if you curl your toes in your shoes just to test it with a Dr Sholls brand, it curls with them. So you could imagine the sliding around while walking etc. These have plenty of cushion for comfort, yet the bottom layer is stiff so they don' slide around. I wear these in my everyday work shoes and my feet feel great.
customer_reviews.author: Helpful Frog

customer_reviews.title: It’s ok depending on what you’re looking to get out of the shoe insert.
customer_reviews.text: I like that it’s tough and sturdy. So it makes the ground feel more stable to me. I feel I have better control of my balance when walking. I’m a electrician so I’m constantly on my feet and climbing ladders. Did not have much pain relief from plantar fasciitis though. If you’re looking for that get the Dr.Scholls “heavy duty support” for men over 200 lbs. Even if your not over the 200. It might be even better since you’re lighter on your feet. That one is the best shoe insert ever.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: My husband is very happy with these. He put them in his tennis shoes and just like the other reviews said, they hurt his feet a bit at first. He only wore them two hours a day at first and then gradually worked up to all day in them. When he wears these he doesn't wake up with his feet hurting when he stands up them during the night. If he doesn't wear them, he is back to being in pain with his plantar fasciitas. Be sure to follow the instructions and you will have good results with these. We hope to get another pair soon for his other shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Healthy Mama

customer_reviews.title: Have bought these for years
customer_reviews.text: Ever since my Podiatrist recommended this orthotic, I have bought them for every new pair of shoe. They last the life of the shoe and do not break down. I have never had to reorder a second pair for the same pair of shoes (even though it's recommended that this be done.) Amazon has the best deals on this orthotic! I had purchased the original pair at a specialty sports store years ago and paid over twice what Amazon sells them for now. If you need a good solid orthotic with arch support, this one is great!
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen

customer_reviews.title: nice product
customer_reviews.text: i use to wear orthopedics from my dr, i tried several different dr.'s, but i was never very happy with the fit. Since those were $400-500 i could not replace them yearly and i could not have multiple sets for different shoes. These work great and at a fraction of the price. I had these 6 month and use them daily and so far so good. even if they do not last a year they are still much better than standard shoe insert
customer_reviews.author: keith ferguson

customer_reviews.title: Great arch support, life changing!
customer_reviews.text: These have changed my life!!! I suffer from terrible knee problems and my physical therapist noticed that my knees bend inward when i walk because i have a low arch. He recommended i try these and they support my arch so much that it has taken away a lot of my knee pain! These are way better than any dr. scholls stuff. Would highly recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: Eloise

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: This is the 2nd pair I have purchased for my husband. They are very comfortable and much less expensive than the one's you get at the podiatrist office. We will con't to order them
customer_reviews.author: cheryl johnson

product_meta.title: Powerstep Pinnacle
product_meta.description:
PRODUCT DETAILS
 *  Product detail sheet [PDF ] 
 * Is Discontinued By Manufacturer :No
 * Product Dimensions :13.8 x 4.5 x 1.8 inches; 6.4 Ounces
 * Item model number :Pinnacle
 * Department :Unisex-adult
 * Date First Available :December 21, 2002
 * Manufacturer :Powerstep Insoles
 * ASIN :B000KPKMX0

 * Amazon Best Sellers Rank: #2,184 in Health & Household (See Top 100 in Health & Household)  *  #8 inShoe Insoles 
   
   

 * Customer Reviews:4.5 out of 5 stars7,792 ratings
feature_bullets: Maximum cushioning: A durable EVA foam base and plush top layer, paired with our variable Cushioning Technology, provide a dual layer of targeted and controlled cushioning, enhancing comfort in your shoes
Semi-rigid arch support: firm yet flexible arch support and deep heel cradle increase foot support and stability – providing greater motion control while walking or running
top fabric: heat and friction reducing fabric helps feet stay cool, dry, and odor-free during strenuous activity – keeping your feet comfortable, healthier, and blister-free

Foot pain prevention and relief: these shoe insoles are the ideal orthotic for pain associated with plantar fasciitis, mild to moderate pronation, metatarsal pain, heel and arch discomfort, flat feet, sore and tired feet, and other common foot conditions

Versatile insole: supports all arch types – low, neutral, and high arches. The insole also fits a variety of shoe types with removable insoles – athletic, casual, dress, and work shoes or boots. Contoured neutral arch support
